means: 使合乎规格，使标准化( standardize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: We use standardized tests to measure scholastic achievement.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们用标准化考试来衡量学生的学业成绩.

sentence.Network_en: The parts of an automobile are standardized.
sentence.Network_cn: 汽车零件是标准化了的.

sentence.Network_en: The standardized fittings can be employed universally.

entry.def: To standardize things means to change them so that they all have the same features.

example.ex: There is a drive both to standardise components and to reduce the number of models on offer...
example.tran: 正在为实现零部件标准化和减少推出的型号数量而努力。

example.ex: He feels standardized education does not benefit those children who are either below or above average intelligence.
example.tran: 他认为标准化教育对那些智力水平低于或超出平均水平的儿童没有好处。

means.word_mean: 1. brought into conformity with a standard;
2. capable of replacing or changing places with something else;

auth_sentence.content: All the major telephone companies have standardized on ATM as the Layer 2 DSL transport protocol.
auth_sentence.res_content: All the major telephone companies have standardized on ATM as the Layer 2 DSL transport protocol.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: All the major telephone companies have standardized on ATM as the Layer 2 DSL transport protocol.

auth_sentence.content: Critics say standardized testing takes teachers' focus off their core mission of educating students.
auth_sentence.res_content: Critics say standardized testing takes teachers' focus off their core mission of educating students.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Critics say standardized testing takes teachers' focus off their core mission of educating students.

auth_sentence.content: As a result, the approach to the management of ADHD by the health-care profession has not been standardized in any way.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: As a result, the approach to the management of ADHD by the health-care profession has not been standardized in any way.

Sentence.sentence: Moreover they site several advantages: alleviation of school overcrowding, strengthen family relationships, lower dropout rates, the facts that students are allowed to learn at their own rate, increased motivation, higher standardized test scores, and reduced discipline problems.

In a study analyzing data on thousands of Ohio State freshmen who lived in dorms, he found that black freshmen who came to college with high standardized test scores earned better grades if they had a white roommate — even if the roommate's test scores were low.
Students who scored low standardized tests
